The cry of innocent blood, sounding to the ear of each member in Parliament being a short relation of the barbarous cruelties inflicted lately upon the peaceable people of God called Quakers, at their meeting in Horsly-down, in the county of Surrey : also some plain-dealing with the persecuting rulers / by C.H. Allen, Robert, fl. 1670. Harriss, Charles.
8 p.
s.n.], [London : 1670.
Signed (p. 6): Robert Allen [& 9 others]. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
